A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Overall I liked the story and did not have a problem with the character development.  Luke's situation seemed appropriate and was a fresh take.  The new characters were good additions and the main story lines were fun and interesting.  

However for being a 2 1/2 hour Star Wars movie I was expecting more pertinent information/development paired with a fast paced adventure similar to TFA (which also had its flaws) but found that there was quite a bit of fat which could still have been trimmed.  

The overall cinematic language of the film felt far too modern and very unlike Star Wars and at times the space battles felt cartoonish.  I found the tone of the movie to be far too silly for my taste\, so many fans notoriously hated on Jar Jar Binks for his childish character and he was just one character\, this movie gave almost every character a chance to be Jar Jar\, and honestly I am not someone who hates Jar Jar.  

The deconstruction of the Star Wars universe and its various tropes is something which could be very interesting if done using the existing cinematic language of the saga however in this case I don't feel like Rian Johnson successfully achieved that.  I appreciate what Johnson was going for\, I really do.  I look forward to seeing where the story takes us from here\, I just really hope the visuals\, editing\, and story telling of future episodic movies returns to a more familiar style.  

I am also interested to see what Rian Johnson does with his trilogy of anthology movies and I believe he will have a stronger showing taking on completely new subjects within this same universe.  May the Force be with you!
